title: How do I start using Trusted Advisor?
description:
For more details see the Knowledge Center article with this video: https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/trusted-advisor-intro
Arun shows you how to start using Trusted Advisor.

title: Trusted Advisor Demo
description: A quick introduction to AWS Trusted Advisor, an application available from AWS Support that inspects your AWS environment and makes recommendations when opportunities exist to save money, improve system availability, improve performance, and close security gaps. To learn more: please see: http://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/

title: Forest Johns AWS Trusted Advisor
description: Product Manage Forest Johns discusses the AWS Trusted Advisor.

title: AWS Webcast - Understanding your Free Trusted Advisor Report
description: You've taken a look at your free Trusted Advisor and would like more in-depth details and an opportunity to ask specific questions about what each check means for your AWS applications. During this one hour session we will walk through each of the 27 checks and outline the significance and best practices benefit that drove the recommendation's inclusion in Trusted Advisor.

title: Trusted Advisor Demo
description: A quick introduction to AWS Trusted Advisor, an application available from AWS Support that inspects your AWS environment and makes recommendations when opportunities exist to save money, improve system availability, and close security gaps. Learn more: http://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/

title: AWS Startup Day - New York: Cost Optimization: Donâ€™t Overspend
description:
Learn more about AWS at - http://amzn.to/2hDlQZY
The less you spend on infrastructure, the more you can invest in other areas of your business. We'll look at how Trusted Advisor, Spot Instances, CloudFront, Reserved Instances, Aurora, Lambda, and API Gateway can help you lower your bill. Gain a deeper understanding of how to set individual team budgets and alerts on forecasted spend. Learn how to quickly identify under-utilized resources and what steps to take to remedy those money wasters. You'll build the essential cost savings toolkit that is applicable across all industries and win the admiration of your finance team.

Speaker: John Pignata, AWS

title: AWS re:Invent 2016: Automated Governance of Your AWS Resources (DEV302)
description: AWS CloudTrail, Amazon CloudWatch Events, AWS Identity & Access Management (IAM), Trusted Advisor, AWS Config Rules, other services? In this session, we will help you use existing and recently launched services to automate configuration governance so that security is embedded in the development process. We outline four easy steps (Control, Monitor, Fix, and Audit) and demonstrate how different services can be used to meet your governance needs. We will showcase real-life examples and you can take home a blog post with code examples and the full source code for scripts and tooling that AWS professional services have built using these services.

title: AWS Cost Optimization: Tools and Methods to  Reduce Your Spend With Us
description:
In this session we will provide an overview of cost optimization levers considering impact vs. complexity to help you find the best areas to get started, demonstrate AWS tools that will help, and share recent cost-related AWS product updates.

You may also like to read a recent blog post titled: 10 things you can do today to reduce AWS costs at https://amzn.to/2yINy2E
